articles.title: Pigeon wearing crystal meth 'like a backpack' caught inside B.C. prison yard - CBC.ca
articles.description: Drug-smuggling pigeons have persisted over the decades, busted from North America to Europe and Asia. Last week, for the first time in recent memory, one was captured at a correctional facility in B.C.
articles.content:
Nearly a century ago, a pigeon breeder approached federal customs officers with a bit of an odd problem.
A pigeon he'd recently sold to a buyer in Mexico had flown back to his home in Texas with two… [+3602 chars]

articles.title: With few entry tests, Southeast Asia may gain most from China's travel revival - Reuters
articles.description: Southeast Asia's tourist economies are set to be leading beneficiaries of China's scrapping of travel bans as they have steered clear of the COVID-19 tests before entry that Europe, Japan and the United States have imposed on Chinese visitors.
articles.content: SINGAPORE, Jan 6 (Reuters) - Southeast Asia's tourist economies are set to be leading beneficiaries of China's scrapping of travel bans as they have steered clear of the COVID-19 tests before entry t… [+4002 chars]

articles.author: Wilhelmine Preussen
articles.title: Belgium declares flu epidemic - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: The flu season kicked off early this year in Europe, increasing pressure on the health care sector.
articles.content:
Belgium's national public health institute Sciensano officially declared a flu epidemic Wednesday, with cases surging to similar levels as COVID-19.
